Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 3: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease (Including Immunizations)

What is a Recruiter?

Do you have a student who is interested in joining the military? The best thing you can do is help them set up a meeting with a recruiter. A recruiter is the subject matter expert on all of the requirements and benefits of their branch of service. A conversation with a recruiter does not commit anyone to military service or even further engagement with that branch or the military in general. In the interest of exploring all available options, you may want to encourage students to talk with Recruiters from more than one branch of service. The various branches of service may have different entrance requirements for the same or similar jobs, for example.

Every year schools should offer parents and students an option to “opt-out” of being contacted by the military, colleges and employers in writing. If a student is on this list, no military recruiter may call or solicit contact with that individual. However, a student may choose to speak with a recruiter, if they initiate the contact, even if they or their parent has put them on the opt-out list.
